page.title: 16HOUSING, MUTHILL.
page.content: The housing in Muthill is a mixture of terraced, detached, semi-detached, and there are still "pre-fabs", erected shortly after 1945, now modernised, and well liked by their occupants. Many of the {older stone built houses date from 1720 onwards, some with walls 70 to 100 cm thick. The rebuilding of Drummond and Willoughby streets followed a horrific incident in January 1716.An order to destroy Muthill,Crieff and Dunning subsequent to the 1715 rebellion led to 50 soldiers, based at Drummond Castle, setting fire to the houses. Guns were pointed at those trying to save their possessions, and they were left to their fate in the snowy night. Many had left the area before Govern- ment compensation was paid in 1722. The most recent building scheme is Ancaster Way, built in 1981/1982.
